title: Contributor Covenant
description: A very **widely-copied** CoC written purposefully for reuse by all projects; popular versions have been 2.0 and 1.4.

title: Open Code of Conduct
description: Written by the TODO Group, a consortia of technology companies, this is declared *outdated* but is still used by some projects.

title: Python Code of Conduct
description: A short and high-level CoC that emphasizes positive behaviors: **Open, Considerate, Respectful**.

title: Citizen Code of Conduct
description: A detailed CoC including events, derived from both the Django CoC and the Geek Feminism one.

title: Ubuntu Code of Conduct
description: A highly community-led focused CoC with detailed expectations of positive behaviors.

title: Django Code of Conduct
description: A medium-length CoC built on the *SpeakUp! CoC* with a moderate level of detail.

title: Geek Feminism
description: A purposeful CoC for prioritizing diversity, with various guides and reviews of CoCs as well; credited to 'created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers.'

title: View Source Code of Conduct
description: CoC with the goal: to be inclusive to the largest number of participants, with the most varied and diverse backgrounds possible. From Mozilla.

title: Speak Up! Community Code of Conduct
description: Widely cited but now-archived CoC, which cites original Fedora and Python Mentorship policies.

title: Python Mentors Code of Conduct
description: Basic CoC for mentors around the original Python Core Team.

title: Ada Initiative Anti-Harassment
description: Detailed GeekFeminism CoC that explicitly credits 'created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers'.

title: PyCon US Events Code of Conduct
description: Master copy of PyCon CoC for all events; credits Covenant, Django, Rust, Citizen, and Affect Conf.

title: Otter Tech CoC Procedures Template
description: Detailed template for CoC policies and procedures meant for easy re-use.

title: Rust Language Code of Conduct
description: Overall Rust language group CoC policies.
